Diagnosis
	1. Left lower lobe adenocarcinoma with NTRK fusion
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb 2024 Palliative radiotherapy to T7 vertebra 20Gy in 5#

	Chemotherapy
	Jan-Mar 2024: 3 cycles carboplatin/pemetrexed
	Mar 2024-present: Entrectinib 600mg daily

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on targeted therapy

	Current issues
	Progressive bone pain despite stable radiological disease

	Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today who has been on entrectinib for 6 weeks. While radiologically stable, she describes worsening bone pain particularly affecting her thoracic spine and left hip. Her mobility has declined significantly over the past month, now requiring a wheelchair for anything more than short distances. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 3.

She is experiencing significant treatment-related toxicities including grade 2 dysgeusia affecting her oral intake, grade 2 fatigue, and intermittent dizziness. Despite these challenges, she wishes to continue with targeted therapy given the lack of alternative treatment options.

CT scan from last week shows stable disease in primary tumor and bone metastases, with no new sites of disease. However, there is evidence of impending cord compression at T7, though currently no neurological deficits are detected.

	Further investigations
	Urgent MRI spine
	Bone density scan

	Medication prescribed
	Increased oxycodone SR to 40mg BD
	Pregabalin 75mg BD started

	Follow up
	Urgent review in 1 week with MRI results
	Referral to acute oncology for consideration of further bone radiotherapy

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function in view of increased opioids
	Weekly blood pressure monitoring due to dizziness on entrectinib
